gurmukhi: eyk imlI kih XO bqIXw ju huqI biRjBUKn kau Aiq ipAwrI ]cMdRBgw biRKBwn suqw ju Dry qn bIc kusuMBn swrI ]
transliteration: Ek Milikah(i) Yau Bateeyaa Ju Houtibrijbhookhan Kau At(i) Pidaree|| Channdrabhagad Brikhbhaan Soutaa Ju Ddare Tan Beech Kousounbhan Sdaree||
translation: Saying thus, Chandarbhaga and Radha, looking charming in their red saris, met Krishna;

gurmukhi: kyl kQw deI Cor rhI ck icqH kI puqrI sI svwrI ]sXwm BnY biRjnwQ qbY sB gÍwrn igAwn hI mY kir fwrI ]2425]
transliteration: Kel Kathaa Daichhodh Rahichak Chitrah Kipoutrisisawdaree|| Syaam Bhanai Brijnaath Tabai Sabh Gvaaran Giaan Himai Kar(i) Ddaree||2425||
translation: Leaving the narration of the story of wonderful play, they are seeing Krishna with wonder and the poet Shyam says that Krishna instructed the gopis about knowledge.2425.

gurmukhi: sun pweI biRj bwlw mohn Awey hY kurKyq ]drSn dyK sBY duK ibsry byd khq ijh nyq ]qn mn AtikXo crn kvl sO Dn invCwvr dyq ]
transliteration: Soun Paaibrij Baalaa Maohan Aae Hai Kurkhet|| Darshan Dekh Sabhai Doukh Bisre Bed Kahat Jih Net|| Tan Man Atkiyo Charan Kaval Sau Dhan Nivchhaadar Det||
translation: The damsels of Braja heard that Krishna had come to Kurukshetra he is the same Krishna, seeing whom all the afflictions come to an end; and who is called eternal (nitya) by the Vedas; our mind and body is absorbed in his lotus-feet and our wealth is a sac

gurmukhi: kiRSn iekwNq kIXo iqh hI iCn khXo igAwn isK lyhu ]iml ibCurn doaU ieh jg mY imiQAw qnu Asnyhu ]2426]
transliteration: Krishan Ikaant Keeyo Tih Chhin Kahyo Giaan Sikh Leh(u)|| Mil Bichhuran Dooo Eh Jag Mai Mithiaa Tan(u) Asneh(u)||2426||
translation: Then Krishna called all of them in seclusion and asking them to engross themselves in the instructions of Knowledge, he said, “The union and separation is the tradition of this world and the love for the body is false.”2426.

gurmukhi: biRjnwiek TwNF Bey auT ky sB guAwrn kO AYsy igAwn diRVwey ]nMd jsomq pMf ky puqRn sMig imly Aiq hyq bFwey ]
transliteration: Brijnaaik Thaandh Bhae Outh Ke Sabh Guooran Kau Aise Giaan Driaae|| Nand Jasomat Pand Ke Poutran San(i) Mile At(i) Het Badhaae||
translation: Krishna got up after imparting to them the instructions about knowledge in this way; Nand and Yashoda were also pleased on meeting the Pandavas;

gurmukhi: kYriv Awie huqo ijqny sB Awpny Awpny Dwm isDwey ]sXwm BnY bhuro biRjnwiek duAwrvqI hUM ky BIqr Awey ]2427]
transliteration: Kairav(i) Aae Houto Jitne Sabh Aapane Aapane Dhaam Sidhaae|| Syaam Bhanai Bahuro Brijnaaik Duaarvatihoon Ke Bheetar Aae||2427||
translation: On this side the Kaurvas also went to their homes and Krishna again returned to Dwarka.2427.

gurmukhi: j`gX qhw kir kY clXo sXwm BnY bsudyv ]ijh ko suq caudh Bvn sB dyvn ko dyv ]2428]
transliteration: Jaggya Tahaa Kar(i) Chadyo Syaam Bhanai Basudev|| Jih Ko Sout Chaudah Bhavan Sabh Devan Ko Dev||2428||
translation: Before leaving, Krishna performed a Yajna, because the son of Vasudev is the god of gods in all the fourteen worlds.2428.

gurmukhi: clXo sXwm jU pRym bFweI ]pUjXo crn ipqw ky jweI ]qwq jbY liK Awvq pwey ]qiRBvn ky krqw Thrwey ]2429]
transliteration: Chadyo Syaam Joo Prem Badhaaee|| Poojyo Charan Pitaa Ke Jaaee|| Taat Jabai Lakh(i) Aavat Paae|| Tribhavan Ke Kartaa Thahraae||2429||
translation: Krishna went away happily and on reaching his home, he worshipped the feet of his father; when his father saw him coming, he recognised him as the creator of all the three worlds.2429.

gurmukhi: bhu ibD hir kI ausqq krI ]mUrq hir kI icq mY DrI ]Apno pRB liK pUjw kInI ]sRI jdubIr jwn sB lInI ]2430]
transliteration: Bahu Bidh Har(i) Kioustat Daree|| Moondat Keenee|| Srijadoubeer Jaan Sabh Leenee||2430||
translation: He praised Krishna in various ways and established the figure of Krishna in his mind; considering him his Lord-God, he worshipped him and Krishna also comprehended the whole mystery in his mind.2430.
